alert.note: Alert for Graham (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 23 at 6:43AM MST until August 23 at 2:10PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...Flooding continues for the following rivers in Arizona... Gila River near Solomon affecting Graham County. For the Upper Gila...Gila River near Solomon. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Gila River near Solomon. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Agricultural flooding begins from Solomon down to Thatcher. Water begins to threaten bridge approaches in the Safford Valley. At 22.5 feet, Bridges in Safford Valley closed and extensive agricultural flooding. Homes and structures closest to the river threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:06 AM MST Tuesday the stage was 21.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:06 AM MST Tuesday was 22.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 12.0 feet early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 215 PM MST.
